# SMS & Advanced Retention Flows — Intus Ecommerce Supplement
**Supplements:** Deliverable 12 (Email Lifecycle System)
**Department:** Distribution & Growth Engine
**Intelligence Source:** Ecommerce Retention Notebook (2025 benchmarks)
**Date:** February 2026

---

## Why This Supplement Exists

Deliverable 12 built a strong email lifecycle system with 5 core flows (Welcome, Kit Quiz, Abandoned Cart, Post-Purchase, Reactivation) and a segmentation strategy anchored to Kit personas. However, it's email-only. SMS is entirely missing — and for a DTC brand targeting Gen Z/Millennials, SMS generates significantly higher revenue per recipient than email campaigns ($0.80 vs $0.11 for top performers). This supplement adds the SMS layer, browse abandonment flow, VIP automation, and A/B testing protocol.

---

## 1. SMS Channel Architecture

### 1.1 Platform: Klaviyo (Unified Email + SMS)

Intus already uses Klaviyo for email (Deliverable 12). Adding SMS within the same platform enables:
- Unified customer profiles (email + SMS behavior in one view)
- Smart Send rules across channels (prevent over-messaging)
- Shared segmentation (Kit personas, VIP, US-based apply to both)
- Simpler compliance management

### 1.2 SMS Compliance Setup

| Requirement | Configuration |
|-------------|--------------|
| **Opt-in collection** | Separate SMS consent checkbox at checkout + "Join the Circle" popup |
| **Multi-step popup** | Step 1: Email (lower friction) → Step 2: SMS ("Unlock first access to new drops via text") |
| **TCPA compliance (US)** | Express written consent required. Double opt-in for US subscribers. |
| **Australian Spam Act** | Commercial SMS requires consent. Include opt-out in every message. |
| **Quiet hours** | No SMS before 8am or after 9pm in recipient's local timezone |
| **Unsubscribe** | Every SMS includes "Reply STOP to unsubscribe" |

### 1.3 SMS Frequency Rules

| Rule | Specification | Rationale |
|------|--------------|-----------|
| **Campaign frequency** | 1-2 SMS campaigns/week | 72% of consumers accept weekly SMS; 45% accept more than once/week |
| **Total touchpoint cap** | Max 3-5 total communications (Email + SMS) per customer per week | Prevents channel fatigue |
| **Growth cadence** | Month 1: 1/week → Month 3: 5-8/month (1 to full list + 1 to engaged segments) | Gradual ramp prevents opt-out spikes |
| **Smart Sending** | ON for campaigns, OFF for first welcome message only | Welcome SMS must be instant for incentive delivery |

---

## 2. SMS Flows (Integrated with Existing Email Flows)

### Flow 1: Welcome Sequence (SMS Layer)

**Supplements Deliverable 12, Flow 1**

The email welcome sequence stays as-is (3 emails over 7 days). SMS runs alongside:

| Message | Timing | Content | Channel |
|---------|--------|---------|---------|
| **SMS 1** | Immediate (same as Email 1) | "Welcome to the circle. Here's your [incentive if applicable]. Explore your Kit: [link]" | SMS |
| Email 1 | Immediate | "Welcome to Intentional Movement." | Email |
| **SMS 2** | Day 5 (between Email 2 and 3) | "Still thinking about your Kit? 60 days to decide. No pressure. [link]" | SMS |
| Email 2 | Day 3 | "What do you do between workouts?" | Email |
| Email 3 | Day 7 | "Wear it. Live in it. Return it if we're wrong." | Email |

**Key rule:** Smart Sending OFF for SMS 1 (incentive must be instant). ON for all subsequent messages.

**Revenue impact:** Welcome flows are often the single highest revenue driver due to peak engagement from new signups.

### Flow 2: Abandoned Cart (SMS Layer)

**Supplements Deliverable 12, Flow 3**

The existing 3-email abandoned cart flow (1hr → 24hr → 72hr) stays. Add SMS as the "closer":

| Message | Timing | Content | Channel |
|---------|--------|---------|---------|
| Email 1 | 1 hour | "Your Kit is waiting." | Email |
| **SMS 1** | 2 hours | "Your [Kit Name] is still in your cart. Complete your Kit: [link]" | SMS |
| Email 2 | 24 hours | "60 days. That's our promise." | Email |
| Email 3 | 72 hours | "Last reminder — then we'll leave you be." | Email |
| **SMS 2** | 48 hours (US only) | "Still thinking? Remember — 60 days to decide. [link]" | SMS (one SMS per event for US compliance) |

**Revenue benchmark:** Abandoned cart flows generate an average of $3.65 per recipient — the highest of any automated flow.

**Rule preserved:** No discounts in abandoned cart. The guarantee is the conversion tool.

### Flow 3: Browse Abandonment (NEW — Not in Deliverable 12)

This flow targets "window shoppers" who viewed a product/Kit but didn't add to cart.

| Message | Timing | Content | Channel |
|---------|--------|---------|---------|
| **SMS 1** | 2 hours after browse | "The [Kit Name] is waiting for you. Rated ★★★★★ by our community. [link]" | SMS |
| Email 1 | 4 hours after browse | Subject: "Still thinking about the [Kit Name]?" — Product image + 2 similar recommendations | Email |
| Email 2 | 48 hours | "What [Kit Name] looks like in real life" — UGC gallery of the browsed Kit | Email |

**Key rules:**
- Trigger only if the visitor viewed a product page for 30+ seconds AND did not add to cart
- Do NOT offer discounts — use social proof and UGC instead to protect margins
- Suppress if visitor enters the Abandoned Cart flow (higher intent takes priority)

**Benchmarks:**
- Open rate: 30-35%
- Conversion rate: 3-5%

### Flow 4: Post-Purchase (SMS Layer)

**Supplements Deliverable 12, Flow 4**

Add SMS touchpoints to the existing 5-email post-purchase sequence:

| Message | Timing | Content | Channel |
|---------|--------|---------|---------|
| Email 1 | Immediate | "Your Kit is on its way." | Email |
| **SMS 1** | Shipping confirmation | "Your Kit just shipped! Track it here: [link]" | SMS |
| **SMS 2** | Delivered (carrier confirmed) | "Your Kit has arrived. Welcome to Intentional Movement." | SMS |
| Email 2 | Day 3 post-delivery | "Welcome to Intentional Movement." | Email |
| Email 3 | Day 14 | "How's The Kit treating you?" | Email |
| **SMS 3** | Day 14 (if no review submitted) | "Love your Kit? Drop a quick review and help someone find theirs: [link]" | SMS |
| Email 4 | Day 30 | "Your Kit has a companion." (cross-sell) | Email |
| Email 5 | Day 55 | "Your 60-day guarantee is almost up." | Email |

### Flow 5: Back-in-Stock Alerts (NEW — Not in Deliverable 12)

Critical for apparel drops where popular sizes and colorways sell out frequently.

| Message | Timing | Content | Channel |
|---------|--------|---------|---------|
| **SMS 1** | Immediately on restock | "The [Kit Name] in [Size/Color] is back. It's waiting for you: [link]" | SMS (speed is critical for limited inventory) |
| Email 1 | 30 minutes after SMS | Same notification with Kit imagery and styling suggestions | Email |

**Implementation:** Add "Notify me when available" button on out-of-stock PDPs. Collect both email and phone number. Prioritize SMS for the first alert (speed ensures interested customers are notified first).

### Flow 6: Win-Back / Hybrid Reactivation (Enhanced from Deliverable 12, Flow 5)

**Supplements Deliverable 12, Flow 5** — adds SMS for email-inactive subscribers.

The original reactivation flow (Day 60 → Day 75 → Day 90 sunset) targets email-only. But email-inactive customers may still be SMS-responsive. Use the "90-day inverse" segment:

| Segment | Definition | Channel |
|---------|-----------|---------|
| **90-day inverse** | No email open/click for 90 days BUT SMS-consented | SMS primary |

| Message | Timing | Content | Channel |
|---------|--------|---------|---------|
| **SMS 1** | Day 0 | "Hey [Name] — it's been a while. We've got some new Kits we think you'll love. [link]" | SMS (friendly, no hard sell) |
| Email 1 | Day 2 | Highlight new products or content | Email |
| **SMS 2** | Day 14 | "Free shipping on your next Kit — just for you. [link]" (free shipping, not discount) | SMS |
| Email 2 | Day 30 | Sunset email: "Should we keep in touch?" | Email |

## 3. VIP & Loyalty Automation (NEW — Not in Deliverable 12)

Deliverable 12 defined a VIP segment (2+ purchases or $200+ lifetime spend) but didn't automate the VIP experience. Tiered loyalty programs generate 1.8x higher ROI than flat programs.

### 3.1 VIP Tier Structure

| Tier | Trigger | Perks |
|------|---------|-------|
| **The Circle** | Email signup | Community content, Movement Philosophy |
| **Kit Owner** | First purchase | Post-purchase flow, Kit persona content, review invitations |
| **Inner Circle** | 2+ purchases OR $200+ spend | Early access to new colorways, founder updates, exclusive content |
| **Movement Maker** | 5+ purchases OR $500+ spend | First access to new Kits, surprise gifts, brand event invitations, behind-the-scenes |

### 3.2 VIP Trigger Automations

| Trigger | Message | Channel |
|---------|---------|---------|
| Customer reaches Inner Circle | "You've officially joined our Inner Circle. Here's what that means for you..." + perks list | Email (rich content) + SMS (celebration alert) |
| Customer reaches Movement Maker | Personal message from founder + exclusive perk | Email + SMS |
| VIP hasn't purchased in 60 days | "We've been saving something for you" + early access to next drop | SMS |
| New colorway/Kit launching | Inner Circle + Movement Maker get 48-hour early access link | SMS (first access alert) → Email (detail) |

### 3.3 Loyalty Economics

| Metric | Target | Why It Matters |
|--------|--------|---------------|
| **VIP purchase frequency** | 3.6x more than non-members | Industry benchmark for successful tier programs |
| **VIP AOV** | 25%+ higher than standard customers | Status + exclusivity drives larger baskets |
| **Repeat purchase rate** | >15% within 90 days (from Deliverable 1) | VIP automation accelerates this toward 25%+ |

**Important:** Intus does NOT discount (Magician archetype rule from Deliverable 4). VIP perks are **access** and **experience** — never price cuts:
- Early access to drops (48-hour window)
- Exclusive colorways
- Founder content and behind-the-scenes
- Brand event invitations
- Surprise gifts (branded accessories, coffee cups from product range)

## 4. List Growth Strategy

### 4.1 Growth Velocity Targets

| Metric | Target | Benchmark |
|--------|--------|-----------|
| **Popup form submit rate** | >3% | Industry benchmark for popup conversion |
| **Monthly list growth (email)** | 3-5% net growth | Healthy for early-stage DTC |
| **Monthly list growth (SMS)** | 2-3% net growth | SMS grows slower (higher friction) but higher value |
| **Checkout SMS opt-in rate** | >15% | Capture high-intent buyers already entering details |

### 4.2 Collection Points

| Touchpoint | Mechanism | Incentive |
|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Homepage popup** | Multi-step: Email (Step 1) → SMS (Step 2) | Email: "Join the Circle" / SMS: "Unlock first access to new drops" |
| **Kit Quiz result** | Collect email + phone to "save your Kit result" | Personalized Kit recommendation saved |
| **Checkout** | SMS consent checkbox (pre-checked OFF for compliance) | "Get shipping updates + early access via text" |
| **Post-purchase** | Email asks for SMS consent | "Want text updates for your next Kit drop?" |
| **Instagram/TikTok** | Link-in-bio to SMS keyword (e.g., text INTUS to [number]) | "Text us for early access" |

## 5. A/B Testing Protocol

### 5.1 Test Priority Order (What to Test First)

Test these variables in this specific order to maximize impact:

| Priority | Variable | Test Setup | Why First |
|----------|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **1** | SMS vs MMS | Standard text vs. image-included message for Kit alerts | 95% of tests show SMS outperforms MMS in conversion — but Intus is a highly visual brand, so validate specifically |
| **2** | Send time | Morning (8-9am) vs. evening (6-7pm) for campaigns | Find the "phone-in-hand" window for the 18-35 audience |
| **3** | Subject lines (email) | Question vs. statement vs. personalized (Kit name) | Highest-volume, lowest-risk test. Run continuously. |
| **4** | CTA language | "Get Your Kit" vs. "Complete Your Kit" vs. "Explore" | Directly impacts click-through rate |
| **5** | Flow timing | Test 1hr vs 2hr vs 4hr for abandoned cart SMS | Find the optimal response window |

### 5.2 Testing Rules

| Rule | Specification |
|------|--------------|
| **Minimum sample size** | 1,000 recipients per variant (wait for statistical significance) |
| **Test duration** | Minimum 7 days (covers all day-of-week variation) |
| **One variable at a time** | Never test subject + send time + content simultaneously |
| **Winner criteria** | Revenue per recipient, not just open rate. Opens are vanity; RPR is the money metric. |
| **Roll-out** | When winner is confirmed (95% confidence), apply to 100% of segment. Move to next test. |

### 5.3 Key Benchmarks to Beat (Apparel & Accessories, Top 10%)

| Metric | Email Target | SMS Target |
|--------|-------------|-----------|
| **Click rate** | >3.5% (from Deliverable 12) | >16.6% |
| **Revenue per recipient** | >$0.11 (campaign average) | >$0.80 |
| **Placed order rate** | Track baseline | >0.59% per campaign |
| **Unsubscribe rate** | <0.3% (from Deliverable 12) | <0.35% per send |

## 6. Updated KPI Dashboard

Extends Deliverable 12, Section 5 with SMS metrics:

| Metric | Email Target | SMS Target | Action if Below |
|--------|-------------|-----------|----------------|
| **Open rate** | >25% | N/A (SMS doesn't track opens) | Subject line test, sender check |
| **Click rate** | >3.5% | >16.6% | Content relevance, CTA test |
| **Revenue per recipient** | >$0.11 | >$0.80 | Segmentation, offer relevance |
| **Unsubscribe rate** | <0.3% | <0.35% | Frequency check, value audit |
| **Spam complaint rate** | <0.1% | N/A | List hygiene, authentication |
| **List growth (monthly)** | 3-5% net | 2-3% net | Popup optimization, new collection points |
| **SMS opt-in rate (checkout)** | — | >15% | Consent copy test, incentive test |
| **Abandoned cart recovery** | Track | $3.65 RPR benchmark | Flow timing, guarantee messaging |

## 7. Implementation Timeline

### Week 1: Foundation
- [ ] Enable Klaviyo SMS channel (compliance setup, sender ID)
- [ ] Build multi-step popup (Email → SMS collection)
- [ ] Add SMS consent checkbox to Shopify checkout
- [ ] Create SMS templates for all flows (use brand voice from Deliverable 6)

### Week 2: Core Flows
- [ ] Add SMS layer to Welcome flow (SMS 1 + SMS 2)
- [ ] Add SMS layer to Abandoned Cart flow (SMS at 2hr)
- [ ] Build Browse Abandonment flow (SMS + Email)
- [ ] Set up Back-in-Stock SMS alerts

### Week 3: Advanced Flows
- [ ] Add SMS to Post-Purchase flow (shipping + delivery + review request)
- [ ] Build VIP tier automation (Inner Circle + Movement Maker triggers)
- [ ] Set up Hybrid Win-Back flow (90-day inverse SMS)
- [ ] Configure Smart Sending rules across all channels

### Week 4: Optimize
- [ ] Launch first A/B test (SMS vs MMS for product alerts)
- [ ] Review first week's SMS performance data
- [ ] Adjust send times based on engagement patterns
- [ ] Set up monthly list growth tracking dashboard
